member.name: T:AutoScrolling.AutoScroller
member.summary: Enables autoscrolling when you drag something beyond the edge of a scrollviewer.

member.name: P:AutoScrolling.AutoScroller.IsPointerCapturedOnPress
member.summary: If set to true, the scrollviewer will capture the pointer when it is pressed. This needs to be set to true if the pointer is not already being captured by the element being interacted with within the ScrollViewer. It should be set to false if the pointer is being captured by elements in the ScrollViewer. The default is false.

member.name: P:AutoScrolling.AutoScroller.AreTouchEventsHandled
member.summary: If set to false, autoscrolling will not be applied for touch interactions. Only set this to true if you are also preventing the default touch/drag behaviour, which is to pan the scrollviewer.

member.name: P:AutoScrolling.AutoScroller.ScrollPixelsPerTick
member.summary: The number of pixels that will be scrolled per 100 milliseconds when scrolling is activated. Default is 5.

member.name: P:AutoScrolling.AutoScroller.IsAutoScrollingEnabled
member.summary: Will the target scrollviewer scroll automatically when an object is dragged to its boundary. Setting this to true applies event handlers to the target scrollviewer. Set it to false to remove the event handlers.

member.name: M:AutoScrolling.AutoScroller.#ctor(Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollViewer,System.Boolean,System.Double)
member.summary: Enables autoscrolling when you drag something beyond the edge of a scrollviewer.
member.param: The ScrollViewer to use automatic scrolling.
If set to false, autoscrolling will not be applied for touch interactions. Only set this to true if you are also preventing the default touch/drag behaviour, which is to pan the scrollviewer.
Scroll rate, specified in the number of pixels per tenth of a second. Default is 20.
